data.title: Added LZ4/LZ4HC support.
data.body:
LZ4 decompression speed is far superior than FASTLZ and ZLIB, and LZ4 compressor is as fast as FASTLZ.
Also set LZ4 compression as default, which was FASTLZ.

data.title: Ability to encapsulate tool subscenes (New ways of using tool keyword)
data.body:
**Issue description:**
Quite often I have tool scene which is working inside editor. Sometimes I need for those scenes to be encapsulated inside other bigger scenes. To make them work in reaction to level designer actions I need to heavily modify the bigger scene, and this usually a lot of work and sometimes it's not even possible (when scenes are using/based on many other scenes/scripts which should not work in tool mode).  

What I would want to have would be some kind of ability to notify child tool subscene about exported variable change without making owner scene a tool, maybe some kind of 'tool redirect' keyword for exported variables?
Maybe even better would be to have more general ability of using 'tool' keyword not for whole scripts, but only for single members/functions instead.  

Though for a second I will be able to overpass this issue with multi-script (different script for normal usage and different script for working inside the editor), but as many people pointed out there is little benefit from introducing multiscript and a lot of problems.

data.title: Various 2.1 cherry picks
data.body:
Cherry pick various PR I did to master which are not back-ported yet:

- #8656 
- #8658 
- #8663 
- #8699 

Also backport a small fix to the compress function from cbbcf72 ( 3044d0a ). It simply returns the length of the written data when decompressing instead of returning a void. This allow my `better-enet` module to compile on `2.1` and possibly other modules for 2.1 to use decompression functions too.

data.title: Use correct error metrics for VRAM textures
data.body:
(I'm writing this just as a TODO for after #8548 is merged)

Both etc2comp and libsquish allow using different error metrics, which we should take advantage of (RGBX for specular, NORMALXYZ for normalmap, and so on).

This will require communicate some hinting for the compressor, which is related to #8459.

data.title: Document exhaustive licensing info of all files
data.body:
Uses the machine-readable debian/copyright standard to be explicit
about both the licenses and the corresponding copyright attributions
for Godot source files and thirdparty libraries bundled in the source
repository.

Fixes #7388.

A second step will be to make a human-readable version ;)

data.title: Using INDEX on a particles shader, breaks the shader
data.body:
**Godot version: Master ed6baffc7**


**Issue description:**
Just using INDEX on a particles shader, breaks the shader.

INDEX is mentioned here https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/4286aef69313e048fa91710c35456c08a252fd3c/servers/visual/shader_types.cpp#L205 , I suppose refers to the same index as the Particles node .


The terminal shows some code, then:
```
ERROR: _display_error_with_code: ParticlesShaderGLES3: Vertex Program Compilation Failed:
0(173) : error C1008: undefined variable "index"

   At: drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.cpp:167.
ERROR: get_current_version: Method/Function Failed, returning: __null
   At: drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.cpp:361.
ERROR: bind: Condition ' !version ' is true. returned: false
   At: drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.cpp:122.
ERROR: _get_uniform: Condition ' !version ' is true. returned: -1
   At: drivers/gles3/shader_gles3.h:376.

```

_Trying to create a variable named INDEX in the shader code gives an error of redefinition of variable._

Then spams this error:


```
mesege
ERROR: _gl_debug_print: GL ERROR: Source: OpenGL	Type: Error	ID: 1282Severity: High	Message: GL_INVALID_OPERATION error generated. No active program.
   At: drivers/gles3/rasterizer_gles3.cpp:123.

```


**Steps to reproduce:**
Use this simple shader code on a Particles node (with assigned mesh):

```
shader_type particles;

void vertex(){
	CUSTOM.y += 10.0*DELTA;
	int a = INDEX;
	
	TRANSFORM = mat4(vec4(1,0,0,0),vec4(0,1,0,0),vec4(0,1,0,0),vec4(CUSTOM.xyz,1));
}
```

data.title: Set video stream playback to a certain position
data.body:
Godot version: 2.1.3

Unfortunately  the is no way to set video stream playback to a certain position. [See VideoPlayer API](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/classes/class_videoplayer.html). I suppose that something like "set_stream_pos( seconds )" could be a desiderable functionality.

data.title: Fix possible memory leak for Android and update gradle
data.body:
there is an error message when compile with latest build tool for android.
```
/godot_dev/platform/android/java/src/com/google/android/vending/expansion/downloader/impl/DownloaderService.java:575: Error: The WIFI_SERVICE must be looked up on the Application context or memory will leak on devices < Android N. Try changing  to .getApplicationContext()  [WifiManagerLeak]
            mWifiManager = (WifiManager) getSystemService(Context.WIFI_SERVICE);
                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

   Explanation for issues of type "WifiManagerLeak":
   On versions prior to Android N (24), initializing the WifiManager via
   Context#getSystemService can cause a memory leak if the context is not the
   application context. Change context.getSystemService(...) to
   context.getApplicationContext().getSystemService(...).

1 errors, 0 warnings
```
this pr will fix the error and update to latest gradle.

data.title: Fix possible memory leak for Android and update gradle
data.body:
there is an error message when compile with latest build tool for android.
```
/godot_dev/platform/android/java/src/com/google/android/vending/expansion/downloader/impl/DownloaderService.java:575: Error: The WIFI_SERVICE must be looked up on the Application context or memory will leak on devices < Android N. Try changing  to .getApplicationContext()  [WifiManagerLeak]
            mWifiManager = (WifiManager) getSystemService(Context.WIFI_SERVICE);
                                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

   Explanation for issues of type "WifiManagerLeak":
   On versions prior to Android N (24), initializing the WifiManager via
   Context#getSystemService can cause a memory leak if the context is not the
   application context. Change context.getSystemService(...) to
   context.getApplicationContext().getSystemService(...).

1 errors, 0 warnings
```
this pr will fix the error and update to latest gradle.

data.title: [3.0] Command line parsing issue
data.body:
I'm trying to add some command line parsing code and have found an issue.

In the editor if I supply a command line:
-lang en
this works fine, if I do:
-lang en -mqwe -Test
this works fine, but if i do:
-lang en -mqwe Test

then it falls over at load time. I suspect it is trying to load Test as a scene as if any command line argument not starting with a - gets treated as the scene to load.

data.title: [GDNative] added varcall and print
Project Settings: Use capitalized properties.
data.body:
There's been some inconsistency between the ProjectSettings and EditorSettings:
One would use `snake_case_properties`, the other `Capitalized Properties`.

This fixes that by also using capitalized properties for the project settings.
(It's actually the default, so the line setting it to false was just removed..)

Was there a strong reason for using snake_case here in the first place?

data.title: removed multiscript
data.body:
After some testing it is clear that this feature isn't as useful as most people thought.
The opposite effect happened. Scripts are designed to be attached to one object, so there are unintuitive behaviours.

Now nobody can say we didn't try again  


RIP MultiScript

data.title: Fix natural sorting order in EditorFileDialog, FileDialog and EditorFileSystemDirectory
data.body:
Make EditorFileDialog, FileDialog and EditorFileSystemDirectory alphanumerical sorting more natural

Added a new method 'naturalnocasecmp_to' and comparator 'NaturalNoCaseComparator' to String.

Fixes #8712.

data.title: Bring back EditorImportPlugin
data.body:
This adds a new implementation of the `EditorImportPlugin` class, allowing to leverage the new importing system via tool scripts.
Will be especially useful when used together with GDNative, to support formats like fbx :)

I'll write docs and a demo soon.

data.title: [3.0] Setting particles lifetime to 0 breaks the particle system
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** Linux, Godot 3 master


**Issue description:**
Setting the 3d particles lifetime to 0 (even though the inspector will set it to 0.1), will render the particle node useless as no particles will be shown again.
Even after restoring all values to a default, nothing will be emitted again


**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Add a 3d particles node
2. Add any mesh to the draw pass and a particle material
3. Set particle lifetime to 0 
4. try to make it work again :)

data.title: Fix one-way collision detection (2.1)
data.body:
This one makes the "max depth" parameter of OWC to be used only during the "unstuck" phase of the body motion algorithm. This is the only way I've found for this to work correctly.

Without this PR, the algorithm usually pushes the kinematic body up to the solid side of the platforms. It's noticebale, for instance, in the kinematic character demo. And if you try to fix that by setting a low or even close to zero "max depth", your character falls through the platform.

With this PR, the mentioned demo as well as the 2D platformer demo keep working as usual, but you can improve them by setting a lower value for the "max depth" on their OWC platforms. Namely, you can fix the noticeable push in the KC demo with a "max depth" of 1.

That is, now "max depth" has this meaning (which I think was always its intended purpose): _how deep at most a body can be with respect to this one for the physics server to force it to a non-overlapping position_.

Also, I've changed the explanation of the one-way collision direction in the docs to reflect how it is actually used by the engine and I've cleared up the usage of the "max depth" property.

@reduz, please have a look and tell me if it's correct and if I have to port it to 3.0. Also note the description and actual meaning of the one way collision direction were inverted, so you can decide how to define it for 3.0.

This might also helps fixing some of the issues people are having with KBs.

data.title: get_overlapping_bodies gives outdated results
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** v2.1.3.stable.official running on arch linux
Happens on android too.

**Issue description:**
The Area2D method get_overlapping_bodies returns outdated results. Calling it twice on the same node positions can give different results.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I started a project with a root node, and inside it a KinematicBody2D that holds a CollisionPolygon2D,
and an Area2D that holds a CollisionShape2D that uses a RectangleShape2D.

I placed the KinematicBody2D outside the Area2D.
The script uses the _fixed_process(delta) callback to do the following:

* Call get_overlapping_bodies() on the Area2D
* Move the KinematicBody2D inside the Area2D using set_pos

I'd expect the get_overlapping_bodies call to return an array with the KinematicBody2D on the 2nd frame. This doesn't happen until the 3rd frame.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[areatest.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/991102/areatest.zip)

This could be related to the following question by another user: https://godotengine.org/qa/6822/getting-inaccurate-results-polling-get_overlapping_bodies

data.title: Browse for file dialog - incorrect ordering
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64

**Issue description:**
When importing a large number of files (textures in my case) the browse for file dialog does not order the file list correctly, which makes it difficult for building SpriteFrames because I must click individually through the files to have the correct frames loaded in order.
As you can see from the screenshot the order is 0, 1, 10, 1000.
Note that when I open up a folder in Windows I do get the correct order, so this behaviour is a bit surprising.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Import -> Texture -> Click the '...' button next to source textures, and browse to a folder with a large list of numbered images.

**Link to minimal example project:**
![screen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1334173/25900578/cec40590-358b-11e7-903b-25b0f8b0a93d.png)


Additional information:
I am guessing the offending line is below which uses a NoCaseComparator:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/df61dc4b2bd54a5a40c515493c76f5a458e5b541/scene/gui/file_dialog.cpp#L340

The link below shows a sorting implementation for this:
https://psycodedeveloper.wordpress.com/2013/04/11/numeric-sort-file-system-names-in-c-like-windows-explorer/

data.title: Broken lighting on Collada mesh with normal map [Intel HD 3000]
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 - Intel HD 3000
Godot 3.0 custom from commit [6d0568d](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/6d0568d8179f7dcca54b1c87ab199820a468ef2c)

**Issue description:**
Mesh imported from collada have a weird lighting.. But testcube are fine..
![screenshot from 2017-05-10 19-38-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10296472/25899198/28066b48-35b9-11e7-9820-b749e8f27a36.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a simple mesh, uv unwrap, and export it with better collada exporter, with tangent arrays exported.. Give it material with normal map, and place some point light or directional light..

**Link to minimal example project:**
[Normal Map Test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/989749/Normal.Map.Test.zip)
normal map by Calinou btw

data.title: Godot 2.1.3 errors when turning on gamepad on iOS
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.3, todays 2.1 branch
iOS 10 running on an iPhone 7

**Issue description:**
I first through this was a result of the changes i made in PR #8695 but I tried this on the main 2.1 branch without any of my changes with the same result.

Starting Godot and turning on an (already paired) game controller on fills the log with:
```
2017-05-10 21:24:53.213013+1000 godot_opt.iphone[14642:6642955] Warning - conversion from 64 bit to 32 bit integral value requested within NSPortCoder, but the 64 bit value 3129508776047653304 cannot be represented by a 32 bit value
2017-05-10 21:24:53.213244+1000 godot_opt.iphone[14642:6642955] Warning - conversion from 64 bit to 32 bit integral value requested within NSPortCoder, but the 64 bit value 3129508776047653304 cannot be represented by a 32 bit value
2017-05-10 21:24:53.215001+1000 godot_opt.iphone[14642:6642955] Warning - conversion from 64 bit to 32 bit integral value requested within NSPortCoder, but the 64 bit value 3129508776047653304 cannot be represented by a 32 bit value
```
I can't find what code is being called that causes this to happen, I'm hoping someone else might have some ideas.

These errors do not happen if the game controller was turned on and connected to the iPhone before Godot starts. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Start a Godot application on iPhone
Turn on a paired MFI gamepad.

data.title: compiling failure with custom module for android
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.3 custom build
Android NDK 14b
Ubuntu 16.04

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I tried to make a custom module for iOS and Android.
only for android, it was fine.
But after adding codes for iOS, fail to compile for Android.
I got this error message.

`modules/libmodules.android.opt.armv7.neon.a(register_module_types.android.opt.armv7.neon.o):modules/register_module_types.cpp:function register_module_types(): error: undefined reference to 'register_module_test_types()'`

after some tests, it happens if `register_types.h` file exists in custom module.
_assume that Android module does not need `register_types.h` at all in this case._

**Steps to reproduce:**
[module_test.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/988835/module_test.tar.gz)
1. unzip it to `modules` and compile for android.
2. see if compile successfully.
3. rename or remove `register_types.h`
4. see if compile successfully.
